headline: Endesa commissions 131MW agriPV portfolio alongside Spanish archaeological site
summary_80w: Spanish utility Endesa has started commercial operations at a 131MW solar PV portfolio in its home country.

headline: Sunrun solar installs fall in Q4 despite 45% revenue growth
summary_80w: Despite posting strong revenue growth for 2025, US residential solar and energy storage installer Sunrun reported a decline in quarterly solar installation.

headline: Daqo New Energy cuts losses and revenues in 2025 as polysilicon sector shifts
summary_80w: Daqo New Energy cut its financial losses and its revenues in 2025 as China’s efforts to moderate its polysilicon industry began to take effect.

headline: Philippines calls for energy storage at all large-scale renewables plants
summary_80w: The Philippines government has announced that large-scale renewable energy installations will have to integrate energy storage into their projects.

headline: Scatec begins construction on 130MW solar PV plant in Colombia as financial close reached
summary_80w: Independent power producer (IPP) Scatec has reached financial close on a 130MW solar PV plant in Colombia.

headline: Yindjibarndi Energy Corporation launches EOI for renewable energy offtake in Western Australia’s Pilbara
summary_80w: YEC has opened an EOI process for commercial and industrial customers seeking renewable energy offtake in Pilbara,Western Australia.

headline: Northvolt’s resurrected factory in Sweden will supply BESS cells to new owner this year, add 1GW data centre development
summary_80w: US energy storage and battery technology startup Lyten has completed its acquisition of Northvolt’s business operations in Sweden and announced its immediate plans.

headline: BW ESS: ‘11.5-hour LDES win moves us into new space for batteries’
summary_80w: We caught up with the CEO of owner-operator BW ESS, Erik Strømsø, about the firm's next deployment plans, tolling trends, procurement and LDES, with its 11.5-hour Bannaby BESS in Australia further proof of lithium-ion's long-duration potential.

headline: Swiss data centre operator NTS Colocation pilots iron-sodium battery tech from US startup Inlyte
summary_80w: Iron-sodium battery manufacturer Inlyte Energy and data centre operator NTS Colocation are partnering to deploy 2MW of iron-sodium battery capacity by 2028.

headline: Where next for the US solar tariff whack-a-mole game?
summary_80w: Analysis: As new duties threaten to block PV producers from India, Laos and Indonesia from the US market, the outcome of the Section 232 polysilicon investigation could put an end to the question of who will be next.

headline: MacLean-Fogg acquires OMCO Solar
summary_80w: US engineering and manufacturing company MacLean-Fogg has acquired solar PV tracker and fixed-tilt solutions manufacturer OMCO Solar.

headline: EIA: US to add record 43.4GW of new utility-scale solar PV capacity in 2026
summary_80w: Developers are forecast to add a record 43.4GW of new solar PV capacity to the US power system in 2026, according to the EIA.

headline: PV project power loss doubled in last five years – Raptor Maps
summary_80w: Power loss at solar PV projects has more than doubled in the last five years despite maturing markets and advancing technology, according to new data from US-based solar asset analysis firm Raptor Maps.

headline: Premier Energies unveils 0BB TOPCon solar cell, India’s ‘first’
summary_80w: Indian solar manufacturer Premier Energies has unveiled a new zero busbar (0BB) TOPCon solar cell, a “first” in India, according to the company.

headline: US PROJECT ROUND-UP: OCI, Arava and Arevon secure finance, MN8 signs PPA with Meta
summary_80w: A round-up of several project stories in the US that have been announced this week, including OCI Energy, Arava Power, Arevon Energy and MN8.

headline: Polysilicon M&A: Tongwei launches bid to acquire Lihao Clean Energy
summary_80w: Chinese polysilicon and PV module manufacturer Tongwei has announced a significant plan to acquire competitor Qinghai Lihao Clean Energy.

headline: Zelestra begins construction at 242MW solar PV plant in Perú
summary_80w: Spanish independent power producer (IPP) Zelestra has started construction at a 242MW solar PV project in Perú.

headline: Co-located storage ‘overhyped’ as fix for underperforming solar PV
summary_80w: Co-located storage has been “overhyped” as a prop for commercially underperforming solar assets in Europe and should not be regarded as a “silver bullet”.

headline: Opportunities for European solar in an uncertain global supply chain
summary_80w: Europe’s somewhat delicate position in global solar means it is uniquely-positioned to take advantage of global supply chain uncertainties.

headline: ‘Social backlash inevitable’: Industry demands data centres stop freeloading on Australia’s clean energy
summary_80w: Australian coalition warns data centres: build own renewables or face backlash. Demand to surge from 3TWh to 30TWh by 2035.

headline: Energy Storage Summit 2026 Day Two: LDES, co-location and revenue certainty among the big topics
summary_80w: Energy Storage Summit 2026 finished yesterday, having brought the industry together for its first major meeting of the year.

headline: Trina Storage to invest in Gore Street’s EU BESS fund, 12GWh targeted
summary_80w: Trina Storage, the BESS arm of Trinasolar, has made a commitment to invest in Gore Street Capital's new EU-focused private BESS fund.

headline: Recurrent Energy sells 200MWh Texas BESS to Hunt Energy Network
summary_80w: Energy storage developer and subsidiary of Canadian Solar, Recurrent Energy, has sold its 200MWh Fort Duncan battery energy storage system (BESS) project, located in Texas, US, to developer Hunt Energy Network.

headline: US DOE closes US$26.5 billion loan package to utility Southern Company for 16GW of capacity, including BESS
summary_80w: The US Department of Energy (DOE) has closed a US$26.5 billion loan package to two wholly owned subsidiaries of utility Southern Company, in Georgia and Alabama, US.

headline: Philippines Department of Energy instructs renewable energy plants to add energy storage
summary_80w: Large-scale renewable energy power plant developers in the Philippines have been instructed to integrate energy storage into their proposed facilities.

headline: ‘Where do I put my chips on the table?’: Long-term BESS revenue curves and uncertainty
summary_80w: Europe’s battery storage sector could benefit from a reassessment of the accuracy, and usage, of revenue modelling.

headline: Google: Minnesota data centre energy deal includes 30GWh ‘multi-day’ iron-air batteries from Form Energy
summary_80w: Utility Xcel Energy will install 30GWh of US startup Form Energy’s iron-air batteries at a data centre in Pine Island, Minnesota, belonging to tech giant Google.

headline: MGA Thermal secures AU$3.25 million ARENA funding for thermal energy storage FEED studies
summary_80w: MGA Thermal has secured AU$3.25 million in funding from ARENA to conduct up to five FEED studies for its thermal energy storage technology.

headline: US clean energy finance matured in 2025 despite policy tightening, says Crux
summary_80w: Clean energy investment in the US remained resilient in 2025 despite political volatility and accelerated tax credit deadlines, reports Crux.

headline: Waratah Super Battery transformer replacement scheduled for Q3 2026 delivery in Australia
summary_80w: Akaysha Energy has confirmed that the replacement transformer for Australia's 850MW Waratah Super Battery will be delivered in Q3 2026.

headline: First Solar, Oxford PV ink US perovskite patent licensing deal

headline: First Solar net sales and gross profit tick upwards in 2025
summary_80w: First Solar has announced net sales of US$1.7 billion for the fourth quarter of 2025, driving full-year sales of US$5.2 billion.

headline: Indian PV manufacturers downplay impact of 125% preliminary US countervailing duty
summary_80w: The US Department of Commerce (DoC) has proposed a 125.87% preliminary countervailing duty (CVD) on Indian solar cells.

headline: Germany’s grid fees and inertia payments highlight contrasts in energy storage regulation
summary_80w: Germany’s energy storage market growth will be hampered by a regulatory decision to potentially charge utility-scale project operators fees for use of the grid, Energy-Storage.news has heard.

headline: Energy storage co-location with solar PV not a ‘silver bullet’

headline: US Roundup: FlexGen updates EMS, LandGate’s BESS site selection tool, ON.Energy-Shoals target data centres, Sunrun’s season of VPP dispatching
summary_80w: In this Energy-Storage.news roundup, FlexGen updates its EMS, LandGate launches a BESS site selection tool, ON.energy and Shoals target AI data centres, and Sunrun has a successful season of dispatching energy with PG&E.

headline: Data centres are ‘convenient scapegoats’ for grid failures, says energy consultant
summary_80w: In an interview with Energy-Storage.news Premium, Jay Jayasuriya, Principal at Sendero Consulting, argues that AI data centres are “convenient scapegoats” for grid failures

headline: Energy Storage Summit 2026 Day One: Reflections and takeaways at Europe’s biggest industry conference
summary_80w: Now in its 11th year and a firm fixture on the industry calendar, the Energy Storage Summit 2026 opened yesterday in London, UK.

headline: Batteries provide ‘flexibility’ in the European renewable revenue stack
summary_80w: BESS are a key facilitator of flexibility in a revenue stack, according to speakers at the 2026 Energy Storage Summit.

headline: RE Developments eyes 1GWh battery storage system in Western Australia
summary_80w: RE Development Pty Ltd has submitted a development application for a 250MW/1,000MWh battery energy storage system (BESS) in Baldivis, Western Australia.

headline: 450MW solar-plus-storage project granted EPBC Act clearance in Australia

headline: Lightsource bp sells 800MWh of co-located battery storage in Australia to Aula Energy
summary_80w: Lightsource bp has sold a 1GW operational solar PV portfolio, with options to build 800MW of co-located battery storage, in Australia.

headline: RES Australia joint venture bags EPBC Act approval for 3.6GWh solar-plus-storage project in Queensland
summary_80w: Wooderson Solar Development Co has secured federal environmental approval for a 450MW solar PV power plant with 3,600MWh of co-located battery energy storage in Queensland, Australia.

headline: European power price volatility creating battery and co-location opportunities
summary_80w: Increased renewable energy penetration in Europe's leading clean energy markets will lead to more fluctuations in power prices.

headline: Scatec reaches COD on Phase 1 of 1.1GW Obelisk solar-plus-storage plant in Egypt

headline: Comstock Metals approved as solar PV module recycler in California

summary_80w: Atlas Renewable Energy has secured refinancing of US$3 billion for a solar and BESS portfolio in Latin America.

headline: How can batteries respond to energy price volatility in Europe?
summary_80w: Fluctuating power prices in Europe present opportunities for BESS developers, according to speakers at the 2026 Energy Storage Summit.

headline: ‘Balance between profitability and predictability’: inside Europe’s shift towards tolling offtake agreements in battery storage
summary_80w: Physical tolling agreements have become increasingly popular in Europe, according to experts at Energy Storage Summit 2026.

headline: BESS continues to be attractive market for M&A
summary_80w: Panellists discussed M&A in large-scale BESS on the 'M&A Market: How Attractive Is BESS Right Now?' panel discussion at the Energy Storage Summit 2026.

headline: DESRI, Clearway move Texas BESS projects forward
summary_80w: D. E. Shaw Renewable Investments (DESRI) has signed a preferred equity investment in IPP Linea Energy's 235MW/470MWh Duffy battery energy storage system (BESS) in Matagorda County, Texas.

headline: ‘No project above 100MW is fully merchant’: Bankability in focus as Energy Storage Summit 2026 kicks off
summary_80w: How to enable bankability for large-scale BESS projects was the main topic of the opening panel discussion at the Energy Storage Summit 2026 which kicked off today (24 February).

headline: Execution discipline redefines energy storage value in Europe, as investable projects become harder to secure
summary_80w: The recent successes of the energy storage market in Europe bring new challenges alongside industry maturity, writes Vicente Abad.

headline: Enel acquires 830MW US PV and wind portfolio, ups renewables investment

headline: GameChange boosts solar eBOS expertise with Terrasmart acquisition

headline: India’s electricity transition accelerates, but state-level gaps persist, says report
summary_80w: Karnataka, Delhi, and Andhra Pradesh top decarbonisation, power ecosystem readiness, and market enablers, respectively, according to a joint report by IEEFA and Ember.

summary_80w: Intertek CEA's Joerg Althaus examines some of the most commonly found tracking and racking defects in PV power plants.

headline: Lightsource bp sells 1GW Australian solar PV portfolio to Aula Energy
summary_80w: Lightsource bp has sold a 1GW operational solar PV portfolio in Australia to Australian-headquartered renewable energy company Aula Energy.

headline: European Union members make mixed progress in implementing energy storage strategies
summary_80w: European Union countries have made limited progress on energy storage deployment and electricity network flexibility recommendations.

headline: FRV set for 1.2GW/5GWh BESS rollout in Spain
summary_80w: Fotowatio Renewable Ventures has unveiled plans for a 1.2GW/5GWh portfolio of battery energy storage system (BESS) projects in Spain.

summary_80w: Operational experience, credibility and optimisation performance are becoming key to BESS bankability, writes Jürgen Mayerhofer, CEO and co-founder of optimiser Enspired.

headline: Quinbrook advances Supernode BESS with 780MW stage two submitted to Australia’s EPBC Act
summary_80w: Quinbrook Infrastructure Partners has submitted the 780MW second stage of its Supernode BESS to Australia’s EPBC Act process for review.

headline: NTPC commissions 165MW at Khavda-II solar project
summary_80w: NTPC has commissioned 165MW of solar capacity at its 1.25GW Khavda-II solar project in Gujarat.

headline: Technical realities could ‘potentially undermine’ Microsoft’s 100% renewables boast
summary_80w: Microsoft met all of its electricity demand with renewables in 2025 and has said it will continue to do so through 2030.

headline: Waiting for a final verdict: Shoals and Voltage both declare victory in eBOS patent dispute
summary_80w: In the last two weeks, both Shoals and Voltage have declared victory in an eBOS patent infringement case, following a ruling from the US ITC.

headline: Origis brings three 145MW solar projects online in Texas
summary_80w: Origis Energy has commissioned three 145MW Swift Air solar facilities in Ector County, Texas, to supply power to Occidental’s operations in West Texas.

headline: 4-hour projects, 15-year toll: Neoen, Statkraft, Zenobē and Infranode progress BESS in Northern Europe
summary_80w: A flurry of BESS project news from big-name players in Western Europe in the run-up to the Energy Storage Summit next week, with Neoen, Statkraft, Zenobē and Infranode moving projects forward in Germany, Ireland, the UK and Denmark. Highlights include a 15-year toll between Drax and Zenobē, and multiple 4-hour duration systems.

headline: VIDEO: The application gap between BESS asset operation data and insights
summary_80w: Energy-Storage.news proudly presents our sponsored webinar with TWAICE, 'The gap between data and insights in BESS operations: findings from the 2026 BESS Pros Survey'.

headline: India: Energy storage tech scope widens with 100MWh flow battery, 100GW pumped hydro and grid-forming BESS prospects
summary_80w: Recent developments from India’s emerging energy storage sector highlight a broadening of interest in diverse technologies and applications.

headline: Enable the next wave of applications and opportunity: Cubenergy’s FlexCombo 2.0 flexible energy storage AC block
summary_80w: Leveraging 12 years of energy storage expertise, Cubenergy has launched FlexCombo 2.0, a next-generation flexible energy storage AC Block.

headline: Tracking the tracker in gigawatt-scale
summary_80w: Statkraft and 3E analysed 64 utility-scale PV plants, representing 2.1GWp DC capacity, with datasets spanning six months to five years.

headline: ‘Each megawatt will be competing’: Wärtsilä on Australia’s evolving grid-scale BESS market
summary_80w: “Australia remains a multi-gigawatt proving ground for utility-scale energy storage systems,” says Kashish Shah of Wärtsilä Energy Storage.

headline: SolarPower Europe’s new hybrid solar + BESS due diligence reports seek to ensure ‘long-term technical excellence’
summary_80w: SolarPower Europe has released two new technical due diligence reports for utility-scale hybrid solar PV and battery energy storage system (BESS) projects.

headline: SolarEdge reduces net loss in 2025 as revenue increases to US$1.1 billion
summary_80w: Israel-headquartered inverter producer SolarEdge has reported revenue of US$1.1 billion in 2025, while reducing its net loss from the previous year.

headline: NexWafe, Talon PV ink 7GW wafer supply agreement in the US
summary_80w: German solar wafer manufacturer NexWafe and US-based cell producer Talon PV have signed a wafer supply agreement in the US.

headline: ‘Think about this in terms of portfolios’: how Europe’s solar investment landscape has shifted towards big-picture thinking
summary_80w: Making investment decisions based on an entire renewable energy portfolio, rather than the merits of an individual project, is now the norm.

headline: Swift Current Energy secures US$248 million for 122MW Maine solar project
summary_80w: Swift Current Energy has secured tax equity financing and US$248 million in project financing for its 122MW Three Rivers Solar facility.

headline: Without transparent energy planning, the lights could go out
summary_80w: A team from Open Energy Transition discusses the benefits of open energy system modelling in assessing resources, including energy storage of varying durations.

headline: US Roundup: California CCAs secure LDES from Hydrostor, ESS Inc. iron-salt acquisition, PowerSecure microgrids enhance New Mexico grid
summary_80w: In this US news roundup, CC Power signs an agreement with Hydrostor for 400MWh of its Willow Rock LDES project, PowerSecure builds microgrids in New Mexico, and ESS Inc acquires VoltStorage.

headline: Moonwatt targets ‘same disruption string inverters had in solar’ with distributed sodium-ion BESS architecture
summary_80w: We hear from Netherlands-based 'distributed hybridisation' sodium-ion BESS startup Moonwatt, as it announces its first project 18 months after being founded and around a year after executives introduced its tech and strategy to Energy-Storage.news.

headline: The Energy Storage Report 2026 out now: grid-forming, fire safety, bankability and more
summary_80w: The 2026 edition of The Energy Storage Report is out now and available to download, charting the key trends, challenges and successes in the industry.

headline: Ukraine’s strategic need for energy storage
summary_80w: Ukraine's government sees energy storage as a tool of strategic national importance as the country weathers Russian attacks and looks to the future.

headline: Australia’s NSW directs ASL to deliver firming tender for 2033-34 capacity shortfall
summary_80w: New South Wales (NSW) energy minister Penny Sharpe has directed ASL to deliver a firming capacity tender addressing forecast energy shortfalls from 2033-34.

headline: Gigawatt-hours of investments, tolls, optimisation and platform financing across Europe this week
summary_80w: Another roundup of European BESS news, but this time around portfolios, partnerships, investments, financing, optimisation and tolling in France, Spain, Belgium, Denmark, Finland and Romania. Notable highlights are Grenergy's 10-year BESS toll in Spain and Ingrid Capacity entering the French market.

headline: Meralco energises Phase 1 of 3.5GW MTerra solar-plus-storage project in the Philippines
summary_80w: Meralco PowerGen Corporation has completed initial grid synchronisation and energisation of the 3.5GW MTerra solar project, which includes a 4.5GWh battery energy storage system (BESS).

headline: Octopus acquires California solar-plus-storage project as part of US$1 billion investment
summary_80w: Octopus Energy has announced an investment of 'nearly' US$1 billion into Californian clean energy, including a solar-plus-storage project.

headline: Solar needs ‘high-resolution data’ to manage weather and grid curtailments, says expert
summary_80w: Data collection and analysis in solar PV installations is increasingly sophisticated, particularly relating to grid interaction and weather forecasting.

headline: Utility-scale solar and wind curtailment exceeds 7TWh in NEM in 2025
summary_80w: Utility-scale solar and wind curtailment in Australia’s NEM reached a record high of over 7TWh in 2025, according to analyst Rystad Energy.

headline: UL Solutions releases cybersecurity certification programme for PV inverters
summary_80w: Testing and Certification company UL Solutions has launched a new cybersecurity certification programme for distributed energy resources (DER) and inverters.

headline: Lydian Energy secures US$689 million for three US BESS and solar projects
summary_80w: IPP Lydian Energy has secured US$689 million in financing for two solar projects and a battery energy storage system (BESS) project in New Mexico, Texas, and Utah, US.

headline: Interim FEOC guidance from US Treasury refers back to existing safe harbour guidelines
summary_80w: The US Treasury’s interim FEOC guidance has outlined “Material Assistance” provisions, which rely heavily on existing safe harbour calculations.

headline: Slow start to global 2026 BESS deployments in January, China continues to dominate
summary_80w: The first monthly global grid-scale BESS deployment figures for 2026 are in from Rho Motion, showing a year-on-year fall and China continuing to account for the majority of activity.

headline: Battery storage can help establish a new era of European energy resilience
summary_80w: More needs to be done to cement energy storage's vital role in European energy resilience, writes Teresa Casacchia, head of storage at Baywa r.e.

headline: New Zealand gentailer Contact Energy eyes US$316 million raise for renewables and energy storage expansion
summary_80w: Contact Energy plans to raise NZ$525 million (US$316 million) in equity funding to fast-track its Contact31+ strategy for its renewable energy and storage pipeline in New Zealand.
